Computes the Theoretical Autocorrelation (ACF) of an ARMA process

Acts as a wrapper around `ARMAacf` to calculate the theoretical ACF process of an ARMA process.

theo_acf(model = ARMA(ar = c(0.5, -0.25), ma = 0.2), lag.max = 20)

Arguments

lag.max
A integer indicating the max length.
ar
A vector containing the AR coefficients
ma
A vector containing the MA coefficients

Examples

# Computes the theoretical ACF for an ARMA(1,0) or better known as an AR(1)
theo_acf(ARMA(ar = -0.25, ma = NULL))
#> , , Theoretical ACF
#> 
#>    Theoretical ACF
#> 0     1.000000e+00
#> 1    -2.500000e-01
#> 2     6.250000e-02
#> 3    -1.562500e-02
#> 4     3.906250e-03
#> 5    -9.765625e-04
#> 6     2.441406e-04
#> 7    -6.103516e-05
#> 8     1.525879e-05
#> 9    -3.814697e-06
#> 10    9.536743e-07
#> 11   -2.384186e-07
#> 12    5.960464e-08
#> 13   -1.490116e-08
#> 14    3.725290e-09
#> 15   -9.313226e-10
#> 16    2.328306e-10
#> 17   -5.820766e-11
#> 18    1.455192e-11
#> 19   -3.637979e-12
#> 20    9.094947e-13
#> 
#> attr(,"type")
#> [1] "Autocorrelation"
#> attr(,"n")
#> [1] 20
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "theo_arma" "ACF"       "array"    
# Computes the theoretical ACF for an ARMA(2, 1)
theo_acf(ARMA(ar = c(.50, -0.25), ma = 0.20), lag.max = 10)
#> , , Theoretical ACF
#> 
#>    Theoretical ACF
#> 0     1.0000000000
#> 1     0.5050000000
#> 2     0.0025000000
#> 3    -0.1250000000
#> 4    -0.0631250000
#> 5    -0.0003125000
#> 6     0.0156250000
#> 7     0.0078906250
#> 8     0.0000390625
#> 9    -0.0019531250
#> 10   -0.0009863281
#> 
#> attr(,"type")
#> [1] "Autocorrelation"
#> attr(,"n")
#> [1] 10
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "theo_arma" "ACF"       "array"
